intro: Epidendrum maculatum, commonly known as the spotted orchid, is a tropical epiphytic orchid native to Central and South America. It features long, arching stems that bear clusters of fragrant, showy flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. The leaves are typically dark green,革质 (leathery), and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining potting media. Its unique spotted patterns on the leaves and flowers make it a popular choice for both indoor and outdoor cultivation.
